intro: Natrix fruticosa, commonly known as the fruticose natrix, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its branched, herbaceous stems that often grow in a shrub-like form. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal in garden settings. Natrix fruticosa is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in moist, open habitats.
